snippet: The brother of a fighter pilot who was burned alive by Islamic State militants said that city workers have the right to carry out their duties without wearing “this ugly color,” as ISIS hostages are forced to wear.
abstract: Jawad al-Kasasbeh, brother of First Lt Moaz al-Kasasbeh, Jordanian pilot burned alve by Islamic State militants, is leading campaign to change color of bright orange uniform worn sanitation workers in Jordan's capital city of Amman; ISIS forces their captives to wear orange jumpsuits in videos that depict executions, and Kasasbeh says it is too grim a reminder of the brutality of ISIS; city officials are considering the change.
lead_paragraph: The brother of a fighter pilot who was burned alive by Islamic State militants said that city workers have the right to carry out their duties without wearing “this ugly color,” as ISIS hostages are forced to wear.

headline.main: Jordanian City Votes to Avoid ISIS Aesthetic
headline.print_headline: Jordanian City Votes to Avoid ISIS Aesthetic

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
